reviewText: Love the old classic westerns. Has several of my favorite movies.

This 4 DVD set includes a whole cross-section of western movies from 1932-1993.  If you're a fan of western's you'll see a lot of familiar faces, some of which will surprise you.  Actors starring in these films include:  John Wayne, Clint Walker, Richard Widmark, Leslie Ann Warren, Ernest Borgnine, Tex Ritter, Buddy Ebsen, Richard Boone, Harry Carey, Daniel Baldwin, etc.  Some are made for TV movies made in the 70's and include popular stars of the day.  The only way you'll see them now is on DVD.  Remember classics like "The House On Green Apple Rd." and "Roll Freddie Roll?"  The TV movies here are of the same era.  Below, I've included a bit of information about each movie.  It includes a  rating from a popular website, scoring each movie from 1-10.  There's 1,612 mins. of western flicks in this collection, a definite bargain for the price.  For those who might be hard of hearing, you should know that these videos do not come with closed captioning.

20 WESTERN MOVIE COLLECTION

The Dawn Rider -  John Wayne (1935)  5.2  Western
When John Mason's father is killed, John is wounded. Attracted to his nurse Alice, a conflict arises between him and his friend Ben who plans to marry Alice. John later finds the killer of his father but goes to face him not knowing Ben has removed the bullets from his gun.  (53 mins)

Yuma - Clint Walker (1971  TV movie)  6.3  Western
A tough marshal is sent to clean up a lawless western town.  (1 hr. 13 mins)

Once Upon A Texas Train -  Richard Widmark, Willie Nelson (1988 TV movie)  6.0  Action, Comedy, Romance
An outlaw and a Texas Ranger captain have a life-long personal feud but 20 years later, with old-age settling-in, they must put their differences aside in order to face the latest Texas problem - the youngest generation of outlaws.  (1 hr. 36 mins.)

The Daughter's of Joshua Cabe - Buddy Ebsen, Leslie Ann Warren, Karen Valentine (1972 TV movie) 6.8
Due to a home-steading law, a fur trapper schemes to keep his land by hiring a hooker, a pickpocket and a thief to pose as his family.  (1 hr. 13 mins.)

Baker's Hawk - Clint Walker, Burl Ives  (1976)  5.7  Western
When a young boy nurses an injured hawk back to health, he gains newfound courage and confidence on his own.  (1 hr. 38 mins)

The Gatling Gun - Guy Stockwell, Robert Fuller (1971) 5.1  Action, Drama, Western
Doctor Gatling invented a war machine to beat all arrows, and guns. (1 hr. 33 mins.)

The Bounty Man - Clint Walker, Richard Basehart (1972 TV movie)  5.9  Western  (1 hr. 13 mins)
Two rival bounty hunters are after the same killer, but find they have to join together to fight off his gang.

The Trackers - Ernest Borgnine, Sammy Davis Jr., (1971 TV movie),  6.1  Western
When a rancher's daughter is kidnapped by Apaches, he forms a posse and sends for the U.S. Marshal but an African-American Deputy Marshal shows up instead. (1 hr. 13 mins.)

Trouble In Texas -  Tex Ritter, Rita Hayworth  (1937)  5.9  Action, Comedy,  Musical  (1 hr. 3 mins)
Tex is on the rodeo circuit looking for the men that killed his brother and he finds them in Middleton. Barker expects his man Squint to win the prize money but when Tex starts winning all the events, they put the poisoned needle in his halter rope, planning to have him mysteriously die just as the others did.

Pony Express Rider - Stewart Petersen, Henry Wilcoxon (1976)  5.3  Western
In 1861 Texas, the son of a poor farmer vows to avenge his father's murder committed by the spoiled son of a rich cattleman.  (1 hr. 40 mins.)

Sitting Bull - Dale Robertson, Mary Murphy (1954)  5.7  Western
A cavalry officer sympathetic to the wronged Sioux fixes a meeting between Chief Sitting Bull and President Grant but a dishonest Indian Agent and a hateful General Custer test the Sioux's patience, threatening to derail the peace-talks.  (1 hr. 45 mins.)

Wind Dancer - Mel Harris, Matt McCoy (1993)  5.1  Family  Drama
When a young girl is injured by a riding accident, she overcomes her injury with the help of her family and her beloved horse.  (! hr. 30 mins.)

Against A Crooked Sky - Richard Boone (1975)  5.5  Family Adventure Western
When Charlotte Sutter is kidnapped by Apaches her brother Sam aided by an old drunk prospector goes searching for her.  (1 hr. 29 mins.)Pilot for TV series of the same name released in 1978. The film told the tale of Molly and David Beaton, two teenage newlyweds, in the Dakota Territory in the 1870s.

Young Pioneers - Linda Purl, Robert Hays  (1976 TV movie)  7.4  Western
Pilot for TV series of the same name released in 1978. The film told the tale of Molly and David Beaton, two teenage newlyweds, in the Dakota Territory in the 1870s.  (1 hr. 37 mins.)

Fort Yuma Gold - Giuliano Gemma (1966)  Western  (1 hr. 40 mins).
Toward the end of the Civil War, a Confederate major plans the daring robbery of his own fort's gold bullion.

One More To Hell - George Hilton  (1968)  5.6  Western  (1 hr. 27 mins.)
Johnny King, a rebellious drifter, sets out to avenge the death of his mentor and friend, Steve, after he has been murdered for his land by the Ward Brothers. After causing some trouble for the Wards, Johnny faces a new opponent, his outlaw friend, Meredith.

Ned Blessing:  True Story of My Life - Daniel Baldwin (1992)  6.3  Western  (1 hr. 37 mins.)
Alone on "Executioner's Row," Ned Blessing is a haggard, old cowboy and former sheriff. With nothing more than reflections on a life that's been filled with danger and excitement, he marks his time waiting and hoping that the man responsible for his imprisonment makes an appearance before the hangman does. With only a few days left to live, Blessing recounts his unbelievable life story.

Call The Mesquiteers - Robt. Livingston, Ray Corrigon (1938)  6.7  Western, Action, Adventure
Smugglers hijack the Mesquiteers truck, but the police catch up, kill the smugglers, and then try to arrest the Mesquiteers as part of the gang. They escape but now have to prove their innocence while being hunted as wanted men.  (55 mins.)

Without Honor -  Harry Carey  (1932)  5.7  Western  (1 hr. 6 mins.)
A gambler joins the Texas Rangers in hopes of finding the true perpetrators of the killings in which his brother is implicated.

Stampede - Charles Starrett  (1936)  6.6  Western  (57 mins.)
A cowboy out to find out who murdered his brother discovers that the killers may not be who he thought they were.

*  A number of the movies allow you to search by chapter.  I don't know if it is available on all of the movies because I have not seen them all yet.
very good for the price. good movies
